jd_format.value:
Job Title

HR Business Partner

Job Code

HRBP-001

Overview

As an HR Business Partner at Humble Bridge, you will play a pivotal role in aligning our HR strategy with business objectives. You will work closely with leadership to drive workforce planning, succession planning, and organizational design. Your expertise in HR management and labor relations will be crucial in enhancing employee experience and facilitating change management.

Company Overview

Humble Bridge is a leading AI/ML company dedicated to driving digital transformation across various industries. We pride ourselves on our innovative solutions and commitment to excellence.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Develop and implement HR strategies aligned with business goals.
  • Provide leadership coaching and support succession planning.
  • Manage labor relations and ensure compliance with Austrian labor law.
  • Enhance employee experience through effective organizational design and change management.
  • Assist in HR projects and initiatives as needed.
  • Support the HR team in various administrative tasks.

Requirements

  • Degree in Business Administration, Psychology, International Cultural and Business Studies, or related field.
  • Advanced degree in HR or related field is a plus.
  • 5 years of experience.
  • HR certification is a plus.
  • Fluent in English (business), conversational in German.
  • Must be authorized to work in Austria.

Skills

  • General knowledge of HR practices and Austrian labor law.
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Office and/or Google Workspace.
  • Strong leadership and coaching skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Experience with HRIS systems (preferred).
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and projects (preferred).

Compensation and Benefits

  • Competitive salary based on experience.
  • Performance-based bonuses.
  • Health insurance, paid time off, and professional development opportunities.
  • A dynamic work environment with opportunities for growth and advancement.

Entry

Immediate availability preferred.

Company Info

Interested candidates should apply with their resume and cover letter.

Address: Humble Bridge, Vienna, Austria.

Application Instructions

Submit your application through our careers page or email it to hr@humblebridge.com.

Reporting Line

Reports to the Head of HR.

Measures of Outcome

Successful implementation of HR strategies and improvement in employee satisfaction scores.

Work Environment

  • Monday to Friday, 9 AM to 5 PM.
  • Minimal travel required.
  • Full-time
  • Onsite in Vienna, Austria.
  • Permanent
  • Standard office environment.

No. of Openings

1

Industry Type

AI/ML

Department

Human Resources

Application Deadline

2023-11-15

Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Statement

Humble Bridge is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Diversity and Inclusion Statement

We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion to drive innovation and success. Our team is committed to fostering a culture where everyone feels valued and respected.

Interview Rounds

The interview process includes an initial phone screening, followed by two rounds of interviews with HR and department heads.

Level

Mid-level
